1.text: Put them in mind to be in subjection to rulers, to authorities, to be obedient, to be ready unto every good work,

2.text: to speak evil of no man, not to be contentious, to be gentle, shewing all meekness toward all men.

3.text: For we also were aforetime foolish, disobedient, deceived, serving divers lusts and pleasures, living in malice and envy, hateful, hating one another.

4.text: But when the kindness of God our Saviour, and his love toward man, appeared,

5.text: not by works done in righteousness, which we did ourselves, but according to his mercy he saved us, through the washing of regeneration and renewing of the Holy Ghost,

6.text: which he poured out upon us richly, through Jesus Christ our Saviour;

7.text: that, being justified by his grace, we might be made heirs according to the hope of eternal life.

8.text: Faithful is the saying, and concerning these things I will that thou affirm confidently, to the end that they which have believed God may be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable unto men:

9.text: but shun foolish questionings, and genealogies, and strifes, and fightings about the law; for they are unprofitable and vain.

10.text: A man that is heretical after a first and second admonition refuse;

11.text: knowing that such a one is perverted, and sinneth, being self-condemned.

12.text: When I shall send Artemas unto thee, or Tychicus, give diligence to come unto me to Nicopolis: for there I have determined to winter.

13.text: Set forward Zenas the lawyer and Apollos on their journey diligently, that nothing be wanting unto them.

14.text: And let our people also learn to maintain good works for necessary uses, that they be not unfruitful.

15.text: All that are with me salute thee. Salute them that love us in faith. Grace be with you all.
